title: Marzuki Nooranas.
text:
Well Hello There!
Hello there! My name is Marzuki Nooranas - or you can call me Marz! I am currently in my 2nd year, double majoring in Sociology and, Communications and New Media! I have always been fascinated by how society functions and its intricate connections, my passion for understanding the world around us, is driven by a desire to foster meaningful connections within all communities!
To demonstrate this, I embark of frequent backpacking trips across Southeast Asia, and actively engage myself in the cultures and learn about their customs. Such experiences provide me with firsthand insights into how different societies interact, and not only broadening my horizons, but also fostering empathy across different communities. Here‚Äôs a little snippet!




@mentaikofries_

overland travel for the vibesss. what a way to end 2022 phewww

nha trang is my favvvvvv

‚ô¨ moth to a flame x after hours - trlixqy







My Past Work
During my time in Temasek Polytechnic, my group mates and I worked on an automated savings platform - Savvify. Essentially, upon making QR Payments through Savvify, the application helps users to round up your payment transactions to the nearest dollar, and crediting it to the users‚Äô e-wallet. Our main goal was to bring new solutions e-payment solutions while helping young adults like us, to understand real life responsibilities - improving financial literacy.



Link to Course Content
https://github.com/mrzknrns/NM2207.git

title: Data Story
text:
In Singapore, housing affordability has been an increasing worry for future Singaporeans. However, in 2012, the then Deputy Prime Minister (DPM) Tharman Shanmugaratnam - stating household income of SGD $1000 was sufficient to own a home, sparked discussions among netizen online (Tan, 2012). While Mr Tharman argued the housing grants could provide support for low-income household, many Singaporeans expressed concern about the long-term viability of such claims, especially in the face of the constant rising cost of living and property prices.
 This is where my introduction will be. This is just a placeholder for potential data sets!

title: Marzuki Nooranas. (Marz)
text:
Savvify - An Automated Savings Platform
During my time in Temasek Polytechnic, my group mates and I worked on an automated savings platform - Savvify. Essentially, the application helps users to round up your payment transactions to the nearest dollar, and crediting it to the users‚Äô e-wallet upon making QR Payments. Our main goal was to bring new solutions e-payment solutions while helping young adults like us, to understand real life responsibilities - improving their financial literacy!

title: Well Hello There!
text:
National University of Singapore

DTK1234 - Design Thinking
In this module, we were assigned the task of innovating everyday chores. Here is my idea: it is basically an attachment that can be clipped to an existing ironing board, so that people - including the elderly or people with disabilities - can iron clothes without feeling tired or unsafe





The actual prototyping journey was not very smooth, but hey, here is the end product! Looks good aye? To me at least‚Ä¶

title: Well Hello There!
text:
Temasek Polytechnic

Savvify - An Automated Savings Platform
During my time in Temasek Polytechnic, my group mates and I worked on an automated savings platform - Savvify. Essentially, the application helps users to round up your payment transactions to the nearest dollar, and crediting it to the users‚Äô e-wallet upon making QR Payments.
Our main goal was to bring new solutions e-payment solutions while helping young adults like us, to understand real life responsibilities - improving their financial literacy!



GIGAWipes - Innovation through Programming
‚ÄúInnovation does not stop‚Äù ‚Äì Here, we explored how to incorporate programming in our daily lives. This may or may not be inspired by true events but for this project, we created a prototype of a toilet roll dispenser but‚Ä¶ I‚Äôll let the video do the talking‚Ä¶

title: Singapore‚Äôs Public Housing Afforability
section: Is Public Housing in Singapore Affordable for the Average Singaporean?
text:
Is Public Housing in Singapore Affordable for the Average Singaporean?

Investigating Singapore‚Äôs Resale Flat Prices from 1990 to 2023


In Singapore, housing affordability has been an increasing worry for future Singaporeans. However, in 2012, the then Deputy Prime Minister (DPM) Tharman Shanmugaratnam - stating household income of SGD $1000 was sufficient to own a home, sparked discussions among netizen online (Tan, 2012). While Mr Tharman argued the housing grants could provide support for low-income household, many Singaporeans expressed concern about the long-term viability of such claims, especially in the face of the constant rising cost of living and property prices.




Trend of HDB Resale Prices in Singapore


Line and Bar Graph


The Distribution of Resale Flat Prices of Different Flat Types


Box Plot


The Impact of Remaining Lease on Resale Prices


Scatter Plot


The influence of Estate on Resale Prices


Violin Plot


Assessing Affordability of Resale Flats in Singapore


Still considering


Conclusion

title: Singapore‚Äôs Public Housing Affordability
section: Is Public Housing in Singapore Affordable for the Average Singaporean?
text:
Is Public Housing in Singapore Affordable for the Average Singaporean?

Investigating Singapore‚Äôs Resale Flat Prices from 1990 to 2022



In Singapore, housing affordability has been an increasing worry for future Singaporeans. However, in 2012, the then Deputy Prime Minister (DPM) Tharman Shanmugaratnam - stating household income of SGD$1000 was sufficient to own a home, sparked discussions among netizen online (Tan, 2012). While Mr Tharman argued the housing grants could provide support for low-income household, many Singaporeans expressed concern about the long-term viability of such claims, especially in the face of the constant rising cost of living and property prices.


Now, this brings an important question to whether public housing in Singapore truly affordable for the average Singaporean in the future. This analysis will also explore the evolving housing market that may impact the affordability of homes for future generations of Singaporeans. The above concerns will uncover the complexities of the housing market, analyse potential long-term trend, also seek to understand that while variables such as estate, size or remaining lease play significant roles, this analysis aims to identity the most influential factors.
According to Kumar (2022),



To understand the trend of housing prices in Singapore, the analysis will use the available data sets from this site. The publicly available data contains historical sales figures on yearly bases, and can be used to access market dynamics and predict future trend. Before moving on to the deeper analysis



Trend of HDB Resale Prices in Singapore














Talk about how the slopes got steeper.
There is a bigger price gap from each flat type to the next flat type.
Compare the price differences on each flat type.
Do some calculations here
Make an interactive shiny for bar graph

Interactive Bar Graph Placeholder









The Distribution of Resale Flat Prices of Different Flat Types


Box Plot Placeholder







The Impact of Remaining Lease on Resale Prices


Scatter Plot







The influence of Estate on Resale Prices


Violin Plot







Assessing Affordability of Resale Flats in Singapore


Still considering


Conclusion
